matrix.adapterDistribution.tasks

Class SubtractRowTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • matrix.adapterDistribution.ITask
      • matrix.adapterDistribution.tasks.SubtractRowTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SubtractRowTask
extends ITask
    This class implements the task of subtracting two sub-matrices. The rows in the sub-matrices range between startRow and endRow. It is used for distributing the operation of subtracting two Matrix.

    It requires the following data to be shared by means of a IDataShared

    • A FactoryMatrix for creating the result matrix associated to the key "factory"

    Author:
    Antonela Tommasel
    See Also:
    MatrixComputationSparseDistributed.subtract(Matrix, Matrix), Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SubtractRowTask(int startRow, int endRow, Matrix leftSubMatrix, Matrix rightSubMatrix)
      Creates the task that calculates the subtract values for rows between startRow and endRow-1.

      • SubtractRowTask

        public SubtractRowTask(int startRow,
               int endRow,
               Matrix leftSubMatrix,
               Matrix rightSubMatrix)
        Creates the task that calculates the subtract values for rows between startRow and endRow-1.
        Parameters:
        startRow - coordinate of the first row to add
        endRow - coordinate of the last row to add
        leftSubMatrix - left minuend of the operation
        rightSubMatrix - subtrahend of the operation
